intro: Astronia cumingiana var. bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored astronia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its striking bi-coloration in its flowers, typically featuring contrasting shades of white and pink. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with showy, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and birds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
